author: T. Downing
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2019
review_content: If you like a loaf of bread with toppings, this is for you.  If you actually want to be able to taste the toppings, consider finding something else.
title: To  much bread, not enough toppings.

author: iLuvAmazon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
review_content: I had this a few times. I tried to cook it a little longer one time and it wasn't any better. It's better to cook this as directed and have that softer hand tossed crust. The pizza sauce has a real good fresh taste that is better than the other DiGiorno offerings. The pepperoni also is tasty and seems to be fresh as well. I like DiGiorno pizzas because they're real easy to cook and don't make a mess in your oven.
title: Really Good Pizza

author: Diva2001a
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
review_content: This is still a very thick crust pizza it‚Äôs just dryer than the average Giorno crust. I do like it better than the other digiornopizzas, but it‚Äôs still rises and is really thick it‚Äôs not like a hand  tossed pizza
title: Still a thick crust

author: LaMarie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2021
review_content: Great quality crust and good flavor! Could use a bit more cheese, but it still puts all the trash pizzerias in my neighborhood to epic shame lol. Will be purchasing again. Hope there are more flavors to come!
title: Uh, YUM!

author: Adam Shroyer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021
review_content: Normally I like digiornos pizzas. The rising crust original one is great. The thin crust is also fantastic, probably my fave of theirs. I expected this to be more of a NY style crust. Hand tossed? This is thick and pillowy. Which is fine if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for. I wanted a thinner crust. Someone doesn‚Äôt know what hand tossed is. Not sure if it‚Äôs me or DiGiorno. üòÇ
title: Just ok, but not hand tossed crust.

author: AS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
review_content: I had nearly given up on frozen pizza until I came across a rating by Cook's Illustrated. It was listed as number 1 for supermarket frozen pizza, so that's why I was willing to give it a shot. I'm glad I did. It's really quite good for store-bought pizza. It's actually better than pizza shops in my area (818 area code), so I'd say it's worth buying.
title: Good frozen pizza as rated by Cook's Illustrated
